statements: INSERT INTO FAQs (id, question, answer) VALUES (1, 'What is SQL?', 'SQL stands for Structured Query Language.');
INSERT INTO FAQs (question, answer, id) VALUES ('How to write a SELECT query?', 'To write a SELECT query, use the syntax SELECT * FROM table_name;.', 2);
INSERT INTO FAQs (answer, question, id) VALUES ('An SQL JOIN clause is used to combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column between them.', 'What is an SQL JOIN?', 3);
INSERT INTO FAQs (id, answer, question) VALUES (4, 'In SQL, the INSERT statement is used to insert new records in a table.', 'What is an INSERT statement?');
INSERT INTO FAQs (question, id, answer) VALUES ('How to update data in SQL?', 5, 'To update data in SQL, use the UPDATE statement with SET clause.');
INSERT INTO FAQs (id, question, answer) VALUES (1, 'What is the capital of France?', 'Paris');
